author: s1na
content:
That's great <@!296630428754771968> ! You're probably counting `codecopy`, but worth a mention (I forgot it initally, luckily tests caught it)!
If the data also showed which bytecode indices were touched, we could try various chunking/merklization algos locally without needing to scan the blocks. But that'll probably grow the dataset size and complexity so not sure if its worth it

author: s1na
content: Oh and re `extcodesize` , probably better to count it, but my guess is we'll have to encode code size at the account level anyway, so it won't be necessary to send the whole contract code only to measure its size

author: axic3354
content: `extcodesize` is used by solidity contracts since a year or two prior to calls to check if destination exists or not.

author: axic3354
content: Also some contracts manually do the same with `extcodehash`. Likely, just how clients store this, the witness should encode both size and hash outside of the code, otherwise merklization is useless.
